channel.title: Windows 10
channel.description:
Anyone have thoughts on this?
Looks good in terms of UI imo.

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @justinxg27 justinxg27

@justinxg27 wrote:

everything after xp and windows7 imho is disgusting to say the least

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:39, topic:552717”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=671634.msg4494901#msg4494901 date=1441228357]

How reliable is the upgrade? I cbf to do a fresh install

you can’t even do a fresh install initially anyway (that was a shitty move microsoft) you are forced to do an upgrade then you can do a fresh install after. However if you purchase windows 10 directly you can use your license for the fresh install. I would assume they didn’t give you a product key for the upgrade so that you couldn’t sell it to others.
[/quote]Can’t mine any data if it’s a fresh install![/quote]
I had to go from tech preview, to W8, then upgrade to W10. There wasn’t any data to mine!

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:34, topic:552717”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=671634.msg4494068#msg4494068 date=1440377967]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=671634.msg4493191#msg4493191 date=1439498480]

There is nothing wrong with windows 8… bitches. I can browse windows 8 faster than any other windows OS and that’s what matters to me. Windows 10 UI isn’t different from windows 8, I can simply change “modes” and everything is fine.

What you guys should be talking about is how microsoft is going to to a subscription service for all ms products. Yes it’s free, but you’re going to pay some way or another and you’re going to be paying for life. Long live microsoft stock.
[/quote]When that happens I have Linux and old Windows 7/XP copies.

It already has happened…
[/quote]Windows 10 isnt subscription based Office 365 is but they still sell 2013[/quote]

yeah I have been using windows 10 for a few weeks now I’ve had nothing in terms and conditions for the various available apps like one note that suggest anything is going to become subscription base after x amount of days. So far the os has been solid for me. One annoyance I’ve run into is that port 80 was opened by a default running service on windows 10 for some IIS nonsense that does not mean anything to me. I know they have had the service since xp but generally its disabled by default but after installing apache I found it to be active.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

The other day i left my laptop on and it updated itself… I like it right now, the UI is so much better because its in the flag icon, and not a whole fucking abnoxious screen, however when i first logged into my user, the screen was blinking, it seemed to be an error with the Windows error Reporting service, i had it disabled, and updated a few programs and it seems cool right now.

Also i like that all apps are desktop-wise now.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:29, topic:552717”]From everything I read Windows 10 will be able to seek out pirated Microsoft applications and disable them.[/quote]Nope. It was one person interpreting the EULA* and making wild assumptions based off of it and then it sparked a whole fear mongering spree that spread all over social media. The new “consensus” has pretty much completely quashed the idea that they will be checking/deleting pirated games from the PC, and if the EULA means anything it’s to help stop people attempting to illegally crack xbox games when logged into a microsoft account.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

I’m gonna stick with Win8 and 7. From everything I read Windows 10 will be able to seek out pirated Microsoft applications and disable them. Figure it won’t be long before other companies buy in to this technology for MS to add support for their own games.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

I’m afraid of the lack of privacy Windows 10 seems to offer. Not talking about 3rd parties getting to your information. I’m talking about how much is shared by default, under the guise of “security”

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I’m running Windows 10 on both of my machines (one laptop one desktop). Quite good so far, no real issues.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Looks pretty good. Just ran the upgrade on a couple units and it was much smoother than 8.0 - 8.1 at least. Looks like the UI is improved, but I pretty much just use keyboard shortcuts and hotkeys anyway, so it doesn’t really make much of a difference. It’s going to be a while before the changes that took place under the hood, the important changes, are really well understood.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

There is nothing wrong with windows 8… bitches. I can browse windows 8 faster than any other windows OS and that’s what matters to me. Windows 10 UI isn’t different from windows 8, I can simply change “modes” and everything is fine.

What you guys should be talking about is how microsoft is going to to a subscription service for all ms products. Yes it’s free, but you’re going to pay some way or another and you’re going to be paying for life. Long live microsoft stock.

item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

I am waiting until Windows 10 is more or less stable.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

was anyone else expecting Cortana to actually use the speakers and talk in windows 10 Desktop

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @Giselle Giselle
item.description:
@Giselle wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:19, topic:552717”][quote author=Giselle link=topic=671634.msg4492105#msg4492105 date=1438744835]
I love 10 personally. Never had any real trouble upgrading, and it just seems like an overall better version of Windows 7.

On a related note, has anyone here tried Microsoft Edge? It’s actually pretty nice. Waiting until they finish the “extensions” stuff before I actually try using it for everyday tasks, though. Need dat adblock. Web Standards-wise, I believe it’s almost up to Firefox’s level, and a HUGE improvement over IE 11.
[/quote]It is a huge improvement but I feel not many are going to swap over either purely because firefox/chrome already works.[/quote]

I agree, though I do plan to swap over to it once extensions are finished to give it a good trial. Need me dat adblock.

It’s quite speedy and slick-looking already, so I’m pretty hyped so far.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“PaulT, post:17, topic:552717”][quote author=Frell link=topic=671634.msg4491519#msg4491519 date=1438318264]
they could have called it windows 8.2 but they already ruined the reputation of 8

at least its free
[/quote]

Actually I think the Windows NT Kernel was internally numbered version 9, so they had to skip to 10 to avoid naming convention issues, and it sounds better anyway.[/quote]
I had heard it was because of people subconsciously thinking Windows '98 when they heard Windows 9 and obviously they still didn’t want to go with that image moving forward. It could have been that or what you said - not sure, I think it was still an interesting theory regardless.

Anyway, I haven’t bothered with Windows 10 still. I heard some good things about it and also heard some bad things about it. I’m not really bothering to worry about it until it’s a couple more months old for all the updates and what not. I’m sure there is still more work to be done which is OK and obviously I understand. We’ll see where it ends up at in a couple of months from now.

Read full topic
